description: The cause of CVE-2024-6991 is identified as a use-after-free flaw within the 'Dawn' component of the Chromium open-source software. This flaw occurs when an object is used after being freed from memory, which can lead to heap corruption. A remote attacker can exploit this vulnerability through specially crafted HTML pages, resulting in potential unauthorized actions on the affected system. This issue affects Microsoft Edge as it utilizes the Chromium engine, which requires timely updates to mitigate the risk associated with this flaw.
